title: ASCII Table
guide:
# The ASCII Table: The Computer's Secret Decoder Ring
## 1. The Concept
Computers don't understand letters like "A", "B", or "C". They only understand **Numbers** (0s and 1s).
So, how do we type words?
We use a **Secret Codebook** called **ASCII** (pronounced "Ass-Key").
Imagine every key on your keyboard has a secret number hidden underneath it.
* When you press "A", the computer hears "65".
* When you press "?", the computer hears "63".
* When you press the Spacebar, the computer hears "32".
There are **128** standard codes (from 0 to 127). We must list them ALL so you can talk to any computer.
**The Groups:**
1. **0-31:** Invisible Robot Commands (bells, lights, enter).
2. **32-47:** Punctuation & Symbols.
3. **48-57:** The Number Drawings (0-9).
4. **65-90:** Big Letters (Uppercase).
5. **97-122:** Small Letters (Lowercase).
## 2. The Complete List (0 to 127)
**Do not skip any. Here is the full dictionary.**
### Part 1: The Invisible Commands (0-31)
These don't print ink on paper. They tell the machine to *do* something.
| Decimal | Name | Description (ELI7) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **0** | NULL | Nothing / Ignore / Spacer |
| **1** | SOH | Start of Heading (Get ready!) |
| **2** | STX | Start of Text (Here comes the message) |
| **3** | ETX | End of Text (Message over) |
| **4** | EOT | End of Transmission (Hanging up the phone) |
| **5** | ENQ | Enquiry (Are you there?) |
| **6** | ACK | Acknowledge (Roger that / I heard you) |
| **7** | BEL | **Bell** (Makes a "Ding!" sound) |
| **8** | BS | **Backspace** (Delete character to the left) |
| **9** | HT | **Tab** (Jump forward) |
| **10** | LF | **Line Feed** (Go down one line - Enter) |
| **11** | VT | Vertical Tab (Jump down) |
| **12** | FF | Form Feed (Eject the paper / New page) |
| **13** | CR | **Carriage Return** (Go back to the start of the line) |
| **14** | SO | Shift Out (Switch color/font) |
| **15** | SI | Shift In (Switch back) |
| **16** | DLE | Data Link Escape |
| **17** | DC1 | Device Control 1 (Turn on) |
| **18** | DC2 | Device Control 2 |
| **19** | DC3 | Device Control 3 (Turn off) |
| **20** | DC4 | Device Control 4 |
| **21** | NAK | Negative Acknowledge (I didn't hear you / Error) |
| **22** | SYN | Synchronous Idle (Wait for me) |
| **23** | ETB | End of Block |
| **24** | CAN | Cancel (Stop!) |
| **25** | EM | End of Medium |
| **26** | SUB | Substitute (Replacement character) |
| **27** | ESC | **Escape** (Get me out of here!) |
| **28** | FS | File Separator |
| **29** | GS | Group Separator |
| **30** | RS | Record Separator |
| **31** | US | Unit Separator |
### Part 2: Symbols, Numbers, and Letters (32-127)
These are the keys you can actually see on the screen.
| Decimal | Character | Note |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **32** | [SPACE] | **The Invisible Space** |
| **33** | ! | Exclamation mark |
| **34** | " | Double Quote |
| **35** | # | Hashtag / Pound |
| **36** | $ | Dollar Sign |
| **37** | % | Percent |
| **38** | & | Ampersand (And) |
| **39** | ' | Single Quote |
| **40** | ( | Open Parenthesis |
| **41** | ) | Close Parenthesis |
| **42** | * | Asterisk (Star) |
| **43** | + | Plus |
| **44** | , | Comma |
| **45** | - | Dash / Minus |
| **46** | . | Dot / Period |
| **47** | / | Forward Slash |
| **48** | **0** | **Number Zero** (Not the same as Null!) |
| **49** | **1** | Number One |
| **50** | **2** | Number Two |
| **51** | **3** | Number Three |
| **52** | **4** | Number Four |
| **53** | **5** | Number Five |
| **54** | **6** | Number Six |
| **55** | **7** | Number Seven |
| **56** | **8** | Number Eight |
| **57** | **9** | Number Nine |
| **58** | : | Colon |
| **59** | ; | Semi-colon |
| **60** | < | Less than |
| **61** | = | Equals |
| **62** | > | Greater than |
| **63** | ? | Question Mark |
| **64** | @ | At sign |
| **65** | **A** | **Uppercase A** |
| **66** | **B** | Uppercase B |
| **67** | **C** | Uppercase C |
| **68** | **D** | Uppercase D |
| **69** | **E** | Uppercase E |
| **70** | **F** | Uppercase F |
| **71** | **G** | Uppercase G |
| **72** | **H** | Uppercase H |
| **73** | **I** | Uppercase I |
| **74** | **J** | Uppercase J |
| **75** | **K** | Uppercase K |
| **76** | **L** | Uppercase L |
| **77** | **M** | Uppercase M |
| **78** | **N** | Uppercase N |
| **79** | **O** | Uppercase O |
| **80** | **P** | Uppercase P |
| **81** | **Q** | Uppercase Q |
| **82** | **R** | Uppercase R |
| **83** | **S** | Uppercase S |
| **84** | **T** | Uppercase T |
| **85** | **U** | Uppercase U |
| **86** | **V** | Uppercase V |
| **87** | **W** | Uppercase W |
| **88** | **X** | Uppercase X |
| **89** | **Y** | Uppercase Y |
| **90** | **Z** | Uppercase Z |
| **91** | [ | Open Bracket |
| **92** | \\ | Backslash |
| **93** | ] | Close Bracket |
| **94** | ^ | Caret (Up arrow) |
| **95** | _ | Underscore |
| **96** | ` | Backtick (Grave accent) |
| **97** | **a** | **Lowercase a** |
| **98** | **b** | Lowercase b |
| **99** | **c** | Lowercase c |
| **100** | **d** | Lowercase d |
| **101** | **e** | Lowercase e |
| **102** | **f** | Lowercase f |
| **103** | **g** | Lowercase g |
| **104** | **h** | Lowercase h |
| **105** | **i** | Lowercase i |
| **106** | **j** | Lowercase j |
| **107** | **k** | Lowercase k |
| **108** | **l** | Lowercase l |
| **109** | **m** | Lowercase m |
| **110** | **n** | Lowercase n |
| **111** | **o** | Lowercase o |
| **112** | **p** | Lowercase p |
| **113** | **q** | Lowercase q |
| **114** | **r** | Lowercase r |
| **115** | **s** | Lowercase s |
| **116** | **t** | Lowercase t |
| **117** | **u** | Lowercase u |
| **118** | **v** | Lowercase v |
| **119** | **w** | Lowercase w |
| **120** | **x** | Lowercase x |
| **121** | **y** | Lowercase y |
| **122** | **z** | Lowercase z |
| **123** | { | Open Curly Brace |
| **124** | \| | Pipe / Vertical Bar |
| **125** | } | Close Curly Brace |
| **126** | ~ | Tilde |
| **127** | DEL | **Delete** (The last command) |
---
## 3. Native Mnemonics (English)
* **"A is for Age 65"**: In many places, 65 is the age you retire. So Big **A** (the first letter) starts at **65**.
* **"The 32 Switch"**: The difference between Big Letters and Small Letters is exactly **32** (The Space).
 * 'A' (65) + 32 = 'a' (97).
 * 'B' (66) + 32 = 'b' (98).
* **"Zero isn't Zero"**: The *number* 0 starts at **48**.
* **"Route 66"**: **B** is **66** (Like the famous highway Route 66).
***
#
